intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. deltophylloides, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of smooth, lanceolate leaves. Its flowering stems bear yellow flower heads composed of numerous small florets. It is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and is considered a weed in some regions.
